facilities.name: Security arch

facilities.description: Electronic Presentation of Evidence (EPE) facilities Internal video conferencing facilities plus external video link to prisons is available. 1 video pod for witnesses is available.
facilities.name: Video facilities

facilities.name: Loop Hearing

facilities.description: A charity café is available 9am to 1pm on the first floor of main waiting area.
facilities.name: Refreshments

facilities.description: There are no parking facilities at this building, however paid off-site parking is available opposite the building.
facilities.name: No parking

facilities.description: Access is restricted for users with mobility difficulties. Public access to the court is via a steep incline and steps. Please contact us to discuss your needs.
facilities.name: Disabled access

facilities.description: Three interview rooms on upper floor and four in the family suite.
facilities.name: Interview room

facilities.description: Guide dogs are welcome at this court.
facilities.name: Assistance dogs

facilities.description: Lifts are available in this building to access the first and second floors. The lift can accommodate wheelchairs up to 117cm wide with a weight limit of 450kg.
facilities.name: Lift

facilities.description: Public toilets are available on all floors.
facilities.name: Public toilets

facilities.description:
1. This building has a public waiting area on the ground floor and a separate witness waiting area. Please ask for details.

2. This building has a public waiting area outside each court or hearing room.
facilities.name: Waiting Room

facilities.description: Accessible toilets are available in the family suite and court 4 waiting area.
facilities.name: Disabled toilet

facilities.description: Baby changing facilities are located on the ground floor.
facilities.name: Baby changing facility

facilities.description: A room can be made available.
facilities.name: Prayer / Quiet room

facilities.description: Support for witnesses is available from Citizens Advice witness service. You can get advice from your local Citizen’s Advice Service ; www.citizensadvice.org.uk. Other advice agencies may be available. Please ask at reception or the counter on the ground floor.
facilities.name: Witness service
